docs.snippet: HAVANA, Dec. 16 -- Dr. Diego Luis Molinari, chairman of the Argentine delegation here, said in a press conference tonight that Argentina was prepared to grant $5,000,000,000 in "graduated and compensated credits" to needy nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Dec. 16 -- Dr. Diego Luis Molinari, chairman of the Argentine delegation here, said in a press conference tonight that Argentina was prepared to grant $5,000,000,000 in "graduated and compensated credits" to needy nations.
docs.abstract: Dr D L Mulinari says nation is ready to loan $5 billion to needy nations

headline.main: ARGENTINA OFFERS FIVE-BILLION FUND; Is Prepared to Widen Marshall Plan With Loans to Needy Nations, Delegate Says

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Dec. 25 -- The United Nations is making plans to convene four seminars on social welfare next year in different parts of the world, it was learned here today.

docs.snippet: The Moore-McCormack liner Argentina, second largest American vessel afloat, will leave the Bethlehem Steel Company's Brooklyn shipyard, where she has been undergoing reconversion, tomorrow morning for her final sea trials.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Dec. 28--The United States delegation to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment still hopes to win the support of enough countries to establish the projected International Trade Organization as an effective working body, it was...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Dec. 28--The United States delegation to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment still hopes to win the support of enough countries to establish the projected International Trade Organization as an effective working body, it was learned today.

headline.main: U. S. STILL HOPING FOR HAVANA PACT; Despite Apparent Deadlock, Delegates Look for Basis of an Effective ITO
